instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00164: What is 820-00164? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7090: What is U7090? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V42_G3H.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  no power when flex cable to Left IO board connected
threads.message:
Hi Everyone.

I am new to this forum and am excited to be a member.
I am an experienced troubleshooter who is terribly rusty at board level diagnosis and repair. I have most of the necessary equipment:  ultrasonic cleaner, AmScope microscope, hot air station, hakko fx-951, quality fluke meter, power supply,  etc.

I have a macbook air 11" MLB <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that I am using as a training board.
It has no liquid contact of any kind.  
Did not power or have any magsafe light when I received it.
Troubleshot and repaired the one wire circuit (thanks Louis!) at and around <CHIP>U7090</CHIP> (a couple dodgy traces and bad resistor).  Magsafe adapter now lights up, but machine does not power UNLESS the flex cable from left IO board is disconnected.  Machine will boot all the way to login.

Further troubleshooting found a bad <TRANSISTOR>Q3080</TRANSISTOR> not passing <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S4SW_TBTBST_FET</SIGNAL> to pin 27 of <CHIP>U3090</CHIP>.
This may have been a lucky find as this circuit seem to be for Thunderbolt. 

NOW:  When flex cable is connected the voltage at cathode side of <DIODE>D3095</DIODE> is 0V
When disconnected it is 15V
I am still getting familiar with the process and in understanding the various power states and how to determine this.
Any and all guidance would be greatly appreciated.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  no power when flex cable to Left IO board connected
threads.message: have you try take the I/O board out to check for signs of liquid ingress? also have you try another I/O board and flex cable?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  no power when flex cable to Left IO board connected
threads.message: When the board doesn't boot with I/O board flex cable plugged in, what are the voltages on <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  no power when flex cable to Left IO board connected
threads.message: sorry for the delay, I've had a terrible cold.  The left IO is new as is the flex cable.  I'm using them as diagnostic parts.  please stand by for the results for checking  <SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> . .  tomorrow if I am better....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  no power when flex cable to Left IO board connected
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> = 8.591 V measured at <RESISTOR>R7006</RESISTOR> pin 1

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> = 3.397V at <CAPACITOR>C7098</CAPACITOR> pin 1

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  no power when flex cable to Left IO board connected
threads.message: Are you using the correct IO board and cable for 2013+ models? Picture of connected board+cable+motherboard?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  no power when flex cable to Left IO board connected
threads.message: I get at least 3 machines a month from stores plugging the dc in flex upside down so this is my first thought.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  no power when flex cable to Left IO board connected
threads.message:
No Title

all parts are from the customer's machine. I'm pretty sure....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  no power when flex cable to Left IO board connected
threads.message: Sorry if it takes me time to respond. I sometimes don't have the time....

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  no power when flex cable to Left IO board connected
threads.message: That IO board is definitely not new, I can see corroded test points in the picture already.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00164</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>  no power when flex cable to Left IO board connected
threads.message: I might have mis spoke about the IO board.  My bad.  I can't recall to be honest.
